Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the potential negative effects of the COVID-19 vaccines by stating that a large number of people will start getting horribly sick and develop autoimmune diseases, without sufficient evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that a large number of people will develop autoimmune diseases as a result of the COVID-19 vaccines.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes a direct causal link between the vaccines and autoimmune diseases, without providing substantial evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence to suggest that the COVID-19 vaccines approved for emergency use in the U.S. cause autoimmune diseases or death.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for any adverse effects experienced by individuals after receiving the vaccine, such as unrelated health conditions or coincidental occurrences.
